intro: Cynophalla mollis, commonly known as the soft cynophalla, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and as a decorative plant in regions with warm, dry climates.
